text: Ardnaree Sarsfields GAA is a Gaelic football club located in Ballina, County Mayo. The club competes in competitions organized by Mayo GAA county board and is a member of the North division. ==History== The club was founded in 1949. ==Honours== *Mayo Junior Football Championship: 1952, 1959, 1971, 2015 *North Mayo Football Championship: 1949, 1950, 1952, 1957, 1958, 1959, 1964, 1966, 1969, 1971, 1979, 2008, 2009, 2010 * Connacht Junior Club Football Championship Winners: 2015 * All-Ireland Junior Club Football Championship: Runners-Up 2016 ==Notable players== Joe Corcoran played with Ardnaree Sarsfields with great distinction and for many is the most recognised former player. Joe Corcoran won 2 county junior titles with Ardnaree Sarsfields (1959 and 1971) and a national football league title with Mayo in 1970. Joe Corcoran was the long-time record scorer for the Mayo senior team with 19-360 (417 points) until 2012 when Conor Mortimer surpassed his total. http://www.mayonews.ie/sports/31752-o-connor-on-the-brink-of-mayo-scoring- record Joe Corcoran also served as a Club President, manager and selector over his years of service to Ardnaree Sarsfields John_Forde - Double All-Ireland Senior Football winner with Mayo 1950 and 1951. John_Forde also served as Club President for Ardnaree Sarsfields. Fr. Peter Quinn - Double All-Ireland Senior Football winner with Mayo 1950 and 1951 ==References== ==External links==
title: Ardnaree Sarsfields GAA
